description: The highest deliverability and detailed analytics of the e-mail messages sent from your system or application.

blocks.name: addEmailTemplate
blocks.description: This function lets you add a message template.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: html
args.info: HTML Message in HTML format. `html` of `text` is required.

args.name: text
args.info: Message in text format. `html` of `text` is required.

blocks.name: sendMail
blocks.description: This function allows you to send messages.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: to
args.info: Required: JSON Object. E-mail address of the recipient. See README for more info.

args.name: smtpAccount
args.info: Required: SMTP account through which you want to send a message.

args.name: subject
args.info: Required: Subject of the message (max. 128 characters).

args.name: html
args.info: HTML Message in HTML format.

args.name: text
args.info: Message in text format.

args.name: from
args.info: E-mail address of the sender.

args.name: fromName
args.info: The displayed name of the sender (max. 128 characters).

args.name: headers
args.info: JSON Object. Additional headers in an array as key => value.

args.name: cc
args.info: E-mail address to which a copy of the message will be sent.

args.name: ccName
args.info: Name of the recipient (max. 128 characters).

args.name: bcc
args.info: E-mail address to which a copy of the message will be sent (hidden address).

args.name: bccName
args.info: Name of the recipient (max. 128 characters).

args.name: replyTo
args.info: E-mail address of `reply to`

args.name: tags
args.info: JSON Array of Strings. Tags of messages in the an array (together max. 128 characters).

args.name: files
args.info: JSON Array of Objects. File attachments. See README for more info.

args.name: to

args.name: templateId
args.info: Template messages Id.

args.name: smtpAccount
args.info: Required: SMTP account through which you want to send a message.

args.name: subject
args.info: Required: Subject of the message (max. 128 characters).

args.name: html
args.info: HTML Message in HTML format.

args.name: text
args.info: Message in text format.

args.name: from
args.info: E-mail address of the sender.

args.name: fromName
args.info: The displayed name of the sender (max. 128 characters).

args.name: headers
args.info: JSON Object. Additional headers in an array as key => value.

args.name: cc
args.info: E-mail address to which a copy of the message will be sent.

args.name: ccName
args.info: Name of the recipient (max. 128 characters).

args.name: bcc
args.info: E-mail address to which a copy of the message will be sent (hidden address).

args.name: bccName
args.info: Name of the recipient (max. 128 characters).

args.name: replyTo
args.info: E-mail address of `reply to`

args.name: files

blocks.name: getAggregatedData
blocks.description: This function allows you to send messages using a previously loaded template or an individually sent template without an entry.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: smtpAccount
args.info: SMTP account name

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: SMTP account name

args.name: dateTo
args.info: Data to in the form of a timestamp. `The difference between date_from and date_to can not be greater than 62 days`.

blocks.name: getAggregatedDataTags
blocks.description: This function allows you to download aggregated data with a division into tags

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: smtpAccount
args.info: SMTP account name

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: SMTP account name

args.name: dateTo
args.info: Data to in the form of a timestamp. `The difference between date_from and date_to can not be greater than 62 days`.

blocks.name: getOpenedEmails
blocks.description: This function allows to download the users e-mail openings, it accepts additional parameters. Queries must be sent using the GET method to the address indicated below.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: offset
args.info: Page number

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results per page

args.name: sort
args.info: Field after which it will be sorted, it is possible to sort by fields: msgid, date, to, processed, created_at, updated_at

args.name: filter
args.info: Additional filtering by fields: to, msgid and created_at

blocks.name: getAllEmailsSendBySMTP
blocks.description: This function allows you to download e-mail messages sent by SMTP server. This option allows you to determine on which fields the search will take place, allowing you to precisely match the result. Queries must be sent using the GET method to the address indicated below.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: offset
args.info: Page number

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results per page

args.name: sort
args.info: Field after which it will be sorted, it is possible to sort by fields: msgid, date, to, processed, created_at, updated_at

args.name: filter
args.info: Additional filtering by fields: `account`, `injected_time`, `message_id`. See README for more info.

blocks.name: getSendEmailsByEvent
blocks.description: This function lets you download e-mail messages based on the status, which it ultimately received. This allows to monitor the addresses to which the correspondence does not reach.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: status
args.info: Required: Mail status. Valid values: `ok`, `softbounce`, `hardbounce`, `spambounce`, `dropped`, `feedback`.

args.name: offset
args.info: Page number

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results per page

args.name: sort
args.info: Field after which it will be sorted, it is possible to sort by fields: `message_id`, `account`, `to`. See README for more info.

args.name: toTime
args.info: Date to in the form of a timestamp.

args.name: filter
args.info: Additional filtering by fields: to, account and to. See README for more info.

blocks.name: getBlacklistedAddresses
blocks.description: This function allows you to download a list of blocked addresses (blacklist), to which e-mails will not be sent. This function accepts additional parameters. Queries should be directed to the address below via a GET method.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: smtpAccount
args.info: SMTP account name

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: SMTP account name

args.name: dateTo
args.info: Data to in the form of a timestamp. `The difference between date_from and date_to can not be greater than 62 days`.

args.name: filter
args.info: Additional filtering by fields: to, account and to. See README for more info.

blocks.name: getBlacklistedAddresses
blocks.description: This function allows you to download a list of blocked addresses (blacklist), to which e-mails will not be sent. This function accepts additional parameters. Queries should be directed to the address below via a GET method.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: offset
args.info: Page number

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results per page

args.name: sort
args.info: Field after which it will be sorted, it is possible to sort by fields: msgid, date, to, processed, created_at, updated_at

args.name: filter
args.info: Additional filtering by fields: account, email, source. See README for more info.

blocks.name: addSingleAddressIntoBlacklist
blocks.description: This function allows you to add an email address to the blacklist, which means it will exclude this address for each subsequent transmission. This function accepts additional parameters. Queries should be sent to the address provided in the documentation via the POST method.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: account
args.info: Smtp account

args.name: email
args.info: E-mail address that will be added

args.name: reason
args.info: Reason for adding to the blacklist

blocks.name: deleteSingleAddressFromBlacklist
blocks.description: This function allows you to remove an email address from the blacklist, it accepts one additional parameter. Query should be directed to the url below via the DELETE method.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: email
args.info: Transfered directly as a component of the url

blocks.name: getAllBlacklistingReasons
blocks.description: This function allows you to download a list of reasons for rejections of e-mail addresses on to the black list. This function does not accept additional parameters

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

blocks.name: checkSingleBlacklistedAddress
blocks.description: This function allows you to check whether an email address is on the blacklist, and for what reason.

args.name: appKey
args.info: Required: App Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: secretKey
args.info: Required: Secret Key obtained from EmailLabs.

args.name: email
args.info: Email to check.

args.name: offset
